Detailed Description

The AdaptivePyramidSwarm can dynamically change its tree structure.

Depending on the optimization behaviour, the AdaptivePyramidSwarm can add or cut off certain subtrees in the hierarchy.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

AdaptivePyramidSwarm::AdaptivePyramidSwarm ( PSO *  pso_p,
int  size,
int  dim,
double  min_x,
double  max_x,
double  min_v,
double  max_v,
int  height,
int  branches,
int  swapDelay,
int  nrScouts 
)

Constructor for H-PSO, setting up the swarm and arranging it in a pyramid shape.

Parameters:
pso_p  The PSO Algorithm for the parameters used
size  The number of birds to create the PyramidSwarm
dim  The dimension of the search space, i.e. the function to be optimized
min_x  Lower bound of x dimension, x0 chosen randomly
max_x  Upper bound of x dimension, x0 chosen randomly
min_v  Lower bound of v dimension, v0 chosen randomly
max_v  Upper bound of v dimension, v0 chosen randomly
height  The height (levels) of the pyramid
branches  How many successors there are on the level below
swapDelay  A swap is only allowed every swapDelay steps
nrScouts  The number of birds for the scouting swarm

The allocated ressources are freed.

Member Function Documentation

void AdaptivePyramidSwarm::decreaseBranchDegree (  )  [virtual]

Transform the tree into a tree with branch degree minus 1.

The worst subtree in each level is cut and the nodes are evenly distributed

Reimplemented from Swarm.

Here is the call graph for this function:

int AdaptivePyramidSwarm::step ( int  steps = 1  )  [protected, virtual]

The AdaptivePyramidSwarm does steps steps.

Within one iteration the following actions are done for all the particles.
The current position is evaluated, within each neighbourhood the iteration best bird is determined and compared to the bird above, the arrangment is adjusted - the best bird per neighbourhood moves up one level, the current velocity is adjusted to the global best bird and the birds are moved.

DEBUG

Reimplemented from PyramidSwarm.

Here is the call graph for this function:

tree< BirdContainer >::iterator AdaptivePyramidSwarm::getLRUSubtree (  )  [protected]

Return the subtree least recently used for providing gbest.

The subtree that hasn't produced the root node for the longest time is returned.

Returns:
iterator to the top node of the LRU subtree.
